com.mousebird.maply

Class MaplyBaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.MaplyBaseController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GlobeController, MapController

    public class MaplyBaseController
extends java.lang.Object
    The base controller is a base class for both Maply and WhirlyGlobe controllers.

    Most of the functionality is shared between the 2D and 3D maps and so it is implemented here.

      • frameInterval

        public int frameInterval
        This is how often we'll kick off a render when the frame sync comes in. We get a notification when the render for a given frame starts, this is usually 60 times a second. This tells us how many to skip to achieve our desired frame rate. 2 means 30hz. 3 means 20hz and so forth.

      • renderWrapper

        protected com.mousebird.maply.RendererWrapper renderWrapper

    • Constructor Detail

      • MaplyBaseController

        public MaplyBaseController(android.app.Activity mainActivity)
        Construct the maply controller with an Activity. We need access to a few of the usual Android resources.

        On construction the Controller will create the scene, the view, kick off the OpenGL ES surface, and construct a layer thread for handling data requests.

        The controller also sets up some default gestures and handles those callbacks.

        Parameters:
        mainActivity - Your main activity that we'll attach ourselves to.

    • Method Detail

      • getScene

        public Scene getScene()
        Return the current scene. Only for sure within the library.

      • getLayerThread

        public LayerThread getLayerThread()
        Returns the layer thread we used for processing requests.

        protected void Init()

      • getContentView

        public android.view.View getContentView()
        Return the main content view used to represent the Maply Control.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Call shutdown when you're done with the MaplyController. It will shut down the layer thread(s) and all the associated logic.

      • addPostSurfaceRunnable

        public void addPostSurfaceRunnable(java.lang.Runnable run)
        Add a runnable to be executed after the OpenGL surface is created.

      • onSurfaceCreatedTask

        public void onSurfaceCreatedTask(java.lang.Runnable run)
        It takes a little time to set up the OpenGL ES drawable. Add a runnable to be run after the surface is created. If it's already been created we just run it here.

        Only call this on the main thread.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()

      • setClearColor

        public void setClearColor(int color)
        Set the color for the OpenGL ES background.

      • setViewExtents

        public void setViewExtents(Point2d ll,
                  Point2d ur)
        Set the viewport the user is allowed to move within. These are lat/lon coordinates in radians.
        Parameters:
        ll - Lower left corner.
        ur - Upper right corner.

      • setPerfInterval

        public void setPerfInterval(int inPerfInterval)
        Report performance stats in the console ever few frames. Setting this to zero turns it off.
        Parameters:
        inPerfInterval -

      • addVector

        public ComponentObject addVector(VectorObject vec,
                        VectorInfo vecInfo,
                        MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Add a single VectorObject. See addVectors() for details.

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer(com.mousebird.maply.Layer layer)
        Add a single layer. This will start processing its data on the layer thread at some point in the near future.

      • removeLayer

        public void removeLayer(com.mousebird.maply.Layer layer)
        Remove a single layer. The layer will stop receiving data and be shut down shortly after you call this.

      • addVectors

        public ComponentObject addVectors(java.util.List<VectorObject> vecs,
                         VectorInfo vecInfo,
                         MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Add vectors to the MaplyController to display. Vectors are linear or areal features with line width, filled style, color and so forth defined by the VectorInfo class.
        Parameters:
        vecs - A list of VectorObject's created by the user or read in from various sources.
        vecInfo - A description of how the vectors should look.
        mode - Where to execute the add. Choose ThreadAny by default.
        Returns:
        The ComponentObject representing the vectors. This is necessary for modifying or deleting the vectors once created.

      • changeVectors

        public void changeVectors(ComponentObject vecObj,
                 VectorInfo vecInfo,
                 MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)

      • addScreenMarker

        public ComponentObject addScreenMarker(ScreenMarker marker,
                              MarkerInfo markerInfo,
                              MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Add a single screen marker. See addScreenMarkers() for details.

      • addScreenMarkers

        public ComponentObject addScreenMarkers(java.util.List<ScreenMarker> markers,
                               MarkerInfo markerInfo,
                               MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Add screen markers to the visual display. Screen markers are 2D markers that sit on top of the screen display, rather than interacting with the geometry. Their visual look is defined by the MarkerInfo class.
        Parameters:
        markers - The markers to add to the display
        markerInfo - How the markers should look.
        mode - Where to execute the add. Choose ThreadAny by default.
        Returns:
        This represents the screen markers for later modification or deletion.

      • addStickers

        public ComponentObject addStickers(java.util.List<Sticker> stickers,
                          StickerInfo stickerInfo,
                          MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Add stickers on top of the globe or map. Stickers are 2D objects that drape over a defined area.
        Parameters:
        stickers - The list of stickers to apply.
        stickerInfo - Parameters that cover all the stickers in question.
        mode - Where to execute the add. Choose ThreadAny by default.
        Returns:
        This represents the stickers for later modification or deletion.

      • changeSticker

        public ComponentObject changeSticker(ComponentObject stickerObj,
                            StickerInfo stickerInfo,
                            MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Change the visual representation for the given sticker.
        Parameters:
        sticker - The sticker to change.
        stickerInfo - Parameters to change.
        mode - Where to execute the add. Choose ThreadAny by default.
        Returns:
        This represents the stickers for later modification or deletion.

      • addScreenLabel

        public ComponentObject addScreenLabel(ScreenLabel label,
                             LabelInfo labelInfo,
                             MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Add a single screen label. See addScreenLabels() for details.

      • addScreenLabels

        public ComponentObject addScreenLabels(java.util.List<ScreenLabel> labels,
                              LabelInfo labelInfo,
                              MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Add screen labels to the display. Screen labels are 2D labels that float above the 3D geometry and stay fixed in size no matter how the user zoom in or out. Their visual appearance is controlled by the LabelInfo class.
        Parameters:
        labels - Labels to add to the display.
        labelInfo - The visual appearance of the labels.
        mode - Where to execute the add. Choose ThreadAny by default.
        Returns:
        This represents the labels for modification or deletion.

      • addTexture

        public MaplyTexture addTexture(android.graphics.Bitmap image,
                      MaplyBaseController.TextureSettings settings,
                      MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Add texture to the system with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        image - Image to add.
        settings - Settings to use.
        mode - Add on the current thread or elsewhere.

      • removeTexture

        public void removeTexture(MaplyTexture tex,
                 MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Remove a texture from the scene with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        tex - Texture to remove.
        mode - Remove immediately (current thread) or elsewhere.

      • addShaderProgram

        public void addShaderProgram(Shader shader,
                    java.lang.String sceneName)
        Associate a shader with the given scene name. These names let us override existing shaders, as well as adding our own.
        Parameters:
        shader - The shader to add.
        sceneName - The scene name to associate it with.

      • addActiveObject

        public void addActiveObject(ActiveObject activeObject)
        Add an active object that will be called right before the render (on the render thread).

      • removeActiveObject

        public void removeActiveObject(ActiveObject activeObject)
        Remove an active object added earlier.

      • disableObjects

        public void disableObjects(java.util.List<ComponentObject> compObjs,
                  MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Disable the given objects. These were the objects returned by the various add calls. Once called, the objects will be invisible, but can be made visible once again with enableObjects()
        Parameters:
        compObjs - Objects to disable in the display.
        mode - Where to execute the add. Choose ThreadAny by default.

      • disableObject

        public void disableObject(ComponentObject compObj,
                 MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Disable the display for the given object.
        Parameters:
        compObj - Object to disable
        mode - Where to execute the enable. Choose ThreadAny by default.

      • enableObjects

        public void enableObjects(java.util.List<ComponentObject> compObjs,
                 MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Enable the display for the given objects. These objects were returned by the various add calls. To disable the display, call disableObjects().
        Parameters:
        compObjs - Objects to enable disable.
        mode - Where to execute the enable. Choose ThreadAny by default.

      • enableObject

        public void enableObject(ComponentObject compObj,
                MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Enable the display for the given object.
        Parameters:
        compObj - Object to enable.
        mode - Where to execute the enable. Choose ThreadAny by default.

      • removeObject

        public void removeObject(ComponentObject compObj,
                MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Remove a single objects from the display. See removeObjects() for details.

      • removeObjects

        public void removeObjects(java.util.List<ComponentObject> compObjs,
                 MaplyBaseController.ThreadMode mode)
        Remove the given component objects from the display. This will permanently remove them from Maply. The component objects were returned from the various add calls.
        Parameters:
        compObjs - Component Objects to remove.
        mode - Where to execute the add. Choose ThreadAny by default.
